page.title: 06Distribution of energy.
page.content: The area used to have a large number of small coal levels i.e. Shafts cut into the mountainside.None now exist and there are no deep-shaft mines. Electricity is generated outside the area and supplied by the National Grid (as is gas, but storage and distribution installation at Blackwood). Gas & electricity services have offices in Blackwood for payments,repairs,sales of appliances etc. Coal is distributed by coal merchants. There are no professional artists/craftsmen in the area but enthusiasts attend classes at Blackwood community centre.
